title: Virtual Pet Hub: Make Feed/Play trigger visible pet reactions (simplified)

requirements.text: In Virtual Pet Hub, when the user presses the “Feed Pet” button, make the pet display perform an immediate, clearly visible reaction (not just a toast). The reaction must be shown in the pet visual area and should last briefly (e.g., ~1–2 seconds) before returning to idle.

quotes: Yes try it again but simpler and when the user presses the feed or play the pet should actually do something.

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Feed Pet” triggers a visible change in the pet visual area (e.g., animation, motion, effect overlay) every time the button is pressed.
The effect is time-bounded and returns to an idle display automatically.
The existing happiness/growth save behavior remains intact (still updates via the existing save mutation).

requirements.text: In Virtual Pet Hub, when the user presses the “Play” button, make the pet display perform an immediate, clearly visible reaction distinct from the Feed reaction (not just a toast). The reaction must be shown in the pet visual area and should last briefly (e.g., ~1–2 seconds) before returning to idle.

quotes: ...when the user presses the feed or play the pet should actually do something.

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Play” triggers a visible change in the pet visual area (e.g., animation, motion, effect overlay) every time the button is pressed.
The Play effect is visually different from the Feed effect.
The effect is time-bounded and returns to an idle display automatically.
The existing happiness/growth save behavior remains intact (still updates via the existing save mutation).

requirements.text: Ensure Feed/Play reactions do not block normal usage: buttons must remain functional and the page must not crash if actions are triggered repeatedly. If a user triggers an action while an animation is already playing, either restart the animation cleanly or queue/replace it in a predictable way.

quotes: Make focused changes only. Ensure no other features or CRUD is impacted.

acceptanceCriteria: Rapidly clicking Feed/Play does not cause UI errors, console exceptions, or a stuck animation state.
The pet visual always returns to an idle state after reactions complete.
No other pages, flows, or CRUD features are modified as part of this change.

constraints: Make focused changes only; do not impact unrelated features or CRUD.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any frontend immutablePaths (compose components instead).
Keep backend schema and persistence unchanged for this update (frontend-only visual behavior).
nonGoals: Implementing the full egg-to-hatch dog/cat lifecycle in this simplified attempt (only Feed/Play reactions are required here).
Adding new backend endpoints or changing the VirtualPetHub Motoko type.
